name: equations
desc: The equations package helps you with:

name: AdaptiveQuadrature
desc:
The "Adaptive quadrature" is a technique for approximating the value of a
definite integral that automatically adjusts the step size based on the
local behavior of the function being integrated.

name: AdaptiveQuadrature.new
desc:
The "Adaptive quadrature" is a technique for approximating the value of a
definite integral that automatically adjusts the step size based on the
local behavior of the function being integrated.

name: integrate
desc:
Calculates the numerical value of the definite function integral
between lowerBound and upperBound. Returns a Record object whose
members are:

name: Algebraic
desc:
An abstract class that represents an algebraic equation, also known as
a polynomial equation, which has a single variable and a maximum degree.

name: Algebraic.from
desc:
Creates an Algebraic object according to the length of coefficients.
In particular:

name: Algebraic.fromReal
desc:
Creates an Algebraic object according to the length of coefficients.
In particular:

name: coefficient
desc:
Returns the coefficient of the polynomial whose degree is degree. For
example:

name: coefficients
desc: The polynomial coefficients.

name: degree
desc: The degree of the polynomial.

name: derivative
desc: The derivative of the polynomial.

name: discriminant
desc: The polynomial discriminant, if it exists.

name: evaluateIntegralOn
desc: Evaluates the definite integral of the polynomial from lower to upper.

name: evaluateOn
desc: Evaluates the polynomial at the given complex value x.

name: factor
desc: Factors the polynomial into irreducible factors.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: isRealEquation
desc: Determines whether the polynomial is real or not.

name: operator *
desc:
The product of two polynomials is performed by multiplying the
corresponding coefficients of the polynomials.

name: operator +
desc:
The sum of two polynomials is performed by adding the corresponding
coefficients.

name: operator -
desc:
The difference of two polynomials is performed by subtracting the
corresponding coefficients.

name: operator /
desc:
This operator divides a polynomial by another polynomial using the
polynomial long division algorithm. The returned AlgebraicDivision type
is a record type that contains both the quotient and the remainder of the
division.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: operator []
desc:
Returns the coefficient of the polynomial at the given index position.
For example:

name: operator unary-
desc:
The unary minus operator changes the sign of every coefficient of the
polynomial. For example:

name: realEvaluateOn
desc: Evaluates the polynomial at the given real value x.

name: solutions
desc: Finds the roots (the solutions) of the associated P(x) = 0 equation.

name: solveInequality
desc: Solves the inequality associated with this polynomial.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: toStringWithFractions
desc:
Returns a string representation of the polynomial where the coefficients
are converted into their fractional representation.

name: AlgebraicDivision
desc:
A record type that holds the quotient and the remainder of a division
between two polynomials. When you use operator/ on two Algebraic
objects, this type is returned. The quotient represents the result of the
division, while the remainder represents what's left after the division.

name: AlgebraicException
desc: Exception object thrown by Algebraic.

name: AlgebraicException.new
desc: Exception object thrown by Algebraic.

name: AlgebraicInequalityAllRealNumbers
desc: A solution of an Algebraic inequality that includes all real numbers.

desc: A solution of an Algebraic inequality that includes all real numbers.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: AlgebraicInequalityGreaterThan
desc: A solution of an Algebraic inequality that is greater than value.

name: AlgebraicInequalityGreaterThan.new
desc: A solution of an Algebraic inequality that is greater than value.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: value
desc: The value.

name: AlgebraicInequalityInterval
desc:
A solution of an Algebraic inequality that is an interval between start
and end values.

name: AlgebraicInequalityInterval.new
desc:
A solution of an Algebraic inequality that is an interval between start
and end values.

name: end
desc: The end of the interval.

name: hashCode

name: operator ==

name: start

name: toString

name: AlgebraicInequalitySmallerThan
desc: A solution of an Algebraic inequality that is smaller than value.

name: operator ==

name: AlgebraicInequalityType
desc: The kind of Algebraic inequality to solve.

name: values

Given an equation in the form Ax = b, A is a square matrix containing

This class can only be built with square matrices.

name: Complex
desc:
A Dart representation of a complex number in the form a + bi where a is
the real part and bi is the imaginary (or complex) part.

name: Complex.fromFraction
desc: Creates a complex number from Fraction objects.

name: Complex.fromImaginary
desc: Creates a complex with only the imaginary part.

name: Complex.fromImaginaryFraction
desc:
Creates a complex number having only the imaginary part expressed as a
Fraction object.

name: Complex.fromImaginaryMixedFraction
desc:
Creates a complex number having only the imaginary part expressed as a
MixedFraction object.

name: Complex.fromMixedFraction
desc: Creates a complex number from MixedFraction objects.

name: Complex.fromPolar
desc:
Creates a complex number from the given polar coordinates where r is the
radius and theta is the angle.

name: Complex.fromReal
desc: Creates a complex with only the real part.

name: Complex.fromRealFraction
desc:
Creates a complex number having only the real part expressed as a
Fraction object.

name: Complex.fromRealMixedFraction
desc:
Creates a complex number having only the real part expressed as a
MixedFraction object.

name: Complex.i
desc: This is the same as calling Complex(0, 1).

name: Complex.new
desc: Creates a complex number with the given real and imaginary parts.

name: Complex.zero
desc: This is the same as calling Complex(0, 0).

name: abs
desc:
Computes the square root of (a2 + b2) where a
is the real part and b is the imaginary part.

name: compareTo
desc: Compares this object to another object.

name: conjugate
desc:
The sign of the imaginary part of current object is changed and the result
is returned in a new Complex instance.

name: copyWith
desc:
Creates a deep copy of this object and replaces (if non-null) the
given values with the old ones.

name: cos
desc: Calculates the cosine of this complex number.

name: cot
desc: Calculates the cotangent of this complex number.

name: exp
desc:
Calculates the base-e exponential of a complex number z where e is the
Euler constant.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: imaginary
desc: The imaginary part of the complex number.

name: isZero
desc: Checks whether the complex number is zero.

name: negate
desc:
The sign of the current object is changed and the result is returned in a
new Complex instance.

name: nthRoot
desc:
Computes the complex n-th root of this object. The returned root is the
one with the smallest positive argument.

name: operator *
desc: The products of two complex numbers.

name: operator +
desc: Sums two complex numbers.

name: operator -
desc: Subtracts two complex numbers.

name: operator /
desc: Divides two complex numbers.

name: operator <
desc:
There is no natural linear ordering for complex numbers. In fact, any
square in an ordered field is >= 0 but in the complex field we have that
i2 = -1.

name: operator <=
desc:
There is no natural linear ordering for complex numbers. In fact, any
square in an ordered field is >= 0 but in the complex field we have that
i2 = -1.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: operator >
desc:
There is no natural linear ordering for complex numbers. In fact, any
square in an ordered field is >= 0 but in the complex field we have that
i2 = -1.

name: operator >=
desc:
There is no natural linear ordering for complex numbers. In fact, any
square in an ordered field is >= 0 but in the complex field we have that
i2 = -1.

name: operator unary-
desc: Returns the negation of this complex number.

name: phase
desc:
Converts rectangular coordinates to polar coordinates by computing an arc
tangent of y/x in the range from -pi to pi.

name: pow
desc:
Calculates the power having a complex number as base and a real value as
exponent. The expression is in the form (a + bi)x.

name: real
desc: The real part of the complex number.

name: reciprocal
desc:
Finds the multiplicative inverse (reciprocal) of the current instance and
returns the result in a new Complex object.

name: sin
desc: Calculates the sine of this complex number.

name: sqrt
desc: Calculates the square root of this complex number.

name: tan
desc: Calculates the tangent of this complex number.

name: toPolarCoordinates
desc:
Converts this object into polar coordinates and wraps them in a new
PolarComplex object.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: toStringAsFixed
desc:
Prints the real and the imaginary parts of this Complex object with
fractionDigits decimal digits. The output produced by this method is the
same that would result in calling toStringAsFixed on a double:

name: toStringAsFraction
desc:
Prints the real and the imaginary parts of the complex number as fractions
with the best possible approximation.

name: toStringWithParenthesis
desc:
Prints the complex number with opening and closing parenthesis in case the
complex number had both real and imaginary part.

name: ComplexException
desc: Exception object thrown by Complex.

name: ComplexException.new
desc: Exception object thrown by Complex.

name: ComplexMatrix
desc:
A simple Dart implementation of an m x n matrix whose data type is
Complex.

name: ComplexMatrix.diagonal
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with diagonalValue in the main diagonal and zeros
elsewhere.

name: ComplexMatrix.fromData
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with values from data.

name: ComplexMatrix.fromFlattenedData
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with values from data.

name: ComplexMatrix.new
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with zeros.

name: characteristicPolynomial
desc:
The characteristic polynomial can only be computed if the matrix is
square, meaning that it must have the same number of columns and rows.

name: choleskyDecomposition
desc:
Uses the Cholesky decomposition algorithm to factor the matrix into
the product of a lower triangular matrix and its conjugate transpose. In
particular, this method returns the L and LT matrices of the

name: cofactorMatrix
desc:
The matrix formed by all of the cofactors of a square matrix is called the
"cofactor matrix".

name: determinant
desc:
The determinant can only be computed if the matrix is square, meaning
that it must have the same number of columns and rows.

name: eigenDecomposition
desc:
Computes the V, D, and V' matrices of the eigendecomposition
algorithm. In particular, this method returns the following matrices:

name: eigenvalues
desc: Returns the eigenvalues associated with this matrix.

name: inverse
desc: Returns the inverse of this matrix.

name: isDiagonal
desc:
A diagonal matrix is a matrix in which all entries outside the main
diagonal are zero.

name: isIdentity
desc:
The identity matrix is a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal
and zeros elsewhere. It is denoted by In, or simply by I.

name: isZero
desc: Checks if the matrix contains only zero elements.

name: luDecomposition
desc:
Factors the matrix as the product of a lower triangular matrix L and
an upper triangular matrix U. The matrix must be square.

name: minor
desc:
A minor of a matrix A is the determinant of some smaller square matrix,
cut down from A by removing one or more of its rows and columns.

name: operator *
desc: Returns the product of two matrices.

name: operator +
desc: Returns the sum of two matrices.

name: operator -
desc: Returns the difference of two matrices.

name: operator /
desc: Returns the division of two matrices.

name: qrDecomposition
desc:
Computes the Q and R matrices of the QR decomposition algorithm. In
particular, this method returns the Q and R matrices of the

name: rank
desc:
The rank of a matrix A is the dimension of the vector space
generated by its columns. This corresponds to the maximal number of
linearly independent columns of A.

name: singleValueDecomposition
desc:
Computes the E, U, and V matrices of the SVD (Singular Value
Decomposition) algorithm. In particular, this method returns the following
matrices:

name: trace
desc:
The trace of a square matrix A, denoted tr(A), is defined as the
sum of elements on the main diagonal (from the upper left to the lower
right).

name: transpose
desc: Returns the transpose of this matrix.

Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a constant value a.

Creates a deep copy of this object and replaces (if non-null) the

name: discriminant

name: Cubic
desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a third degree

desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a third degree

desc:
The first coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = 0

name: b
desc:
The second coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = 0

name: c
desc:
The third coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = 0

Creates a deep copy of this object and replaces (if non-null) the

name: d

The value used to check if a coefficient is very close to zero. In other
words, if |a| < epsilon, then a is considered to be zero.

Evaluates the mathematical expression and returns the result. This
method has to be used to evaluate those expression that do not contain

Evaluates the mathematical expression and replaces the x variable with
the value of the given evaluationPoint.

name: Matrix
desc:
A matrix with rowCount rows and columnCount columns. This abstract type
allows the implementation of different types of matrices, each with their
own specific methods and types. This library implements:

name: Matrix.diagonal
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with diagonalValue in the main diagonal and zeros
elsewhere.

name: Matrix.fromData
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with values from data.

name: Matrix.fromFlattenedData
desc:
Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with values from data.

name: Matrix.new
desc:
A matrix with rowCount rows and columnCount columns. This abstract type
allows the implementation of different types of matrices, each with their
own specific methods and types. This library implements:

name: call
desc:
Use this method to retrieve the element at a given position in the matrix.
For example:

name: characteristicPolynomial
desc:
The characteristic polynomial can only be computed if the matrix is
square, meaning that it must have the same number of columns and rows.

name: choleskyDecomposition
desc:
Uses the Cholesky decomposition algorithm to factor the matrix into
the product of a lower triangular matrix and its conjugate transpose. In
particular, this method returns the L and LT matrices of the

name: cofactorMatrix
desc:
The matrix formed by all of the cofactors of a square matrix is called the
"cofactor matrix".

name: columnCount
desc: The number of columns in the matrix.

name: determinant
desc:
The determinant can only be computed if the matrix is square, meaning
that it must have the same number of columns and rows.

name: eigenDecomposition
desc:
Computes the V, D, and V' matrices of the eigendecomposition
algorithm. In particular, this method returns the following matrices:

name: eigenvalues
desc: Returns the eigenvalues associated with this matrix.

name: flattenData
desc: An unmodifiable, flattened representation of the matrix data.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: inverse
desc: Returns the inverse of this matrix.

name: isDiagonal
desc:
A diagonal matrix is a matrix in which all entries outside the main
diagonal are zero.

name: isIdentity
desc:
The identity matrix is a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal
and zeros elsewhere. It is denoted by In, or simply by I.

name: isSquareMatrix
desc: Determines whether the matrix is square or not.

name: isSymmetric
desc:
A symmetric matrix is a square matrix that is equal to its transpose.
Because equal matrices have equal dimensions, only square matrices can be
symmetric.

name: isZero
desc: Checks if the matrix contains only zero elements.

name: itemAt
desc:
Use this method to retrieve the element at a given position in the matrix.
For example:

name: luDecomposition
desc:
Factors the matrix as the product of a lower triangular matrix L and
an upper triangular matrix U. The matrix must be square.

name: minor
desc:
A minor of a matrix A is the determinant of some smaller square matrix,
cut down from A by removing one or more of its rows and columns.

name: operator *
desc: Returns the product of two matrices.

name: operator +
desc: Returns the sum of two matrices.

name: operator -
desc: Returns the difference of two matrices.

name: operator /
desc: Returns the division of two matrices.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: qrDecomposition
desc:
Computes the Q and R matrices of the QR decomposition algorithm. In
particular, this method returns the Q and R matrices of the

name: rank
desc:
The rank of a matrix A is the dimension of the vector space
generated by its columns. This corresponds to the maximal number of
linearly independent columns of A.

name: rowCount
desc: The number of rows in the matrix.

name: singleValueDecomposition
desc:
Computes the E, U, and V matrices of the SVD (Singular Value
Decomposition) algorithm. In particular, this method returns the following
matrices:

name: toList
desc: Returns a modifiable "flattened" view of the matrix as a List<T> object.

name: toListOfList
desc: Returns a modifiable view of the matrix as a List<List<T>> object.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: trace
desc:
The trace of a square matrix A, denoted tr(A), is defined as the
sum of elements on the main diagonal (from the upper left to the lower
right).

name: transpose
desc: Returns the transpose of this matrix.

name: transposedValue
desc:
Returns the value at (row, col) position as if this matrix were
transposed. For example, let's say we have this matrix:

name: MatrixException
desc: Exception object thrown by Matrix.

name: MatrixException.new
desc: Exception object thrown by Matrix.

name: MidpointRule
desc:
The midpoint rule is a numerical integration technique for approximating
definite integrals using Riemann sums. Given a definite integral in the
form [a,b] f(x) dx, the midpoint rule approximates it as:

name: Newton
desc:
Implements Newton's method (also known as the Newton-Raphson method) to find
the roots of a given equation.

name: Newton.new
desc:
Implements Newton's method (also known as the Newton-Raphson method) to find
the roots of a given equation.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: solve
desc:
Generates the succession generated by the root-finding algorithm. Returns
a Record object whose members are:

name: x0
desc: The initial guess x0.

name: NewtonInterpolation
desc:
Newton interpolation (also known as Newton's divided difference
interpolation) is a polynomial interpolation method that constructs an
interpolation polynomial for a given set of data points using divided
differences.

name: NewtonInterpolation.new
desc:
Newton interpolation (also known as Newton's divided difference
interpolation) is a polynomial interpolation method that constructs an
interpolation polynomial for a given set of data points using divided
differences.

name: backwardDifferenceTable
desc:
Computes the backward differences table and stores the results in a
RealMatrix object.

name: compute
desc: Returns the y value of the y = f(x) equation.

name: forwardDifference
desc:
When true, the algorithm uses forward differences.
When false, the algorithm uses backward differences.

name: forwardDifferenceTable
desc:
Computes the forward differences table and stores the results in a
RealMatrix object.

name: NonLinear
desc:
An abstract class that represents a nonlinear equation, which can be solved
with a particular root-finding algorithm. No complex numbers are allowed.

name: NonLinear.new
desc:
An abstract class that represents a nonlinear equation, which can be solved
with a particular root-finding algorithm. No complex numbers are allowed.

name: convergence
desc:
To get a meaningful result, it makes sense to compute the rate of
convergence only if there are at least 4 guesses in the guesses
list (which means at least 3 iterations were performed).

name: efficiency
desc:
Computes the efficiency of the algorithm using the convergence rate.
The formula is:

name: evaluateDerivativeOn
desc: Evaluates the derivative of the function on the given x value.

name: evaluateOn
desc: Evaluates the function on the given x value.

name: function
desc: The function f(x) for which the algorithm has to find a solution.

name: maxSteps
desc: The maximum number of iterations to be made by the algorithm.

name: solve
desc:
Generates the succession generated by the root-finding algorithm. Returns

desc: A string representation of this object.

name: tolerance

name: NonlinearException

desc: Exception object thrown by NonLinear.

name: NumericalIntegration
desc:
When it comes to analysis, the term numerical integration indicates a
group of algorithms for calculating the numerical value of a definite
integral on an interval.

name: NumericalIntegration.new
desc:
When it comes to analysis, the term numerical integration indicates a
group of algorithms for calculating the numerical value of a definite
integral on an interval.

name: evaluateFunction
desc: Evaluates the given function at the x point.

name: function
desc: The function to be integrated on the given interval.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

Calculates the numerical value of the definite function integral
between lowerBound and upperBound. Returns a Record object whose

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: upperBound
desc: The upper bound of the integral.

name: PolarComplex
desc:
A wrapper class, returned by a Complex object, that represents a complex
number in polar coordinates.

name: PolarComplex.new
desc:
A wrapper class, returned by a Complex object, that represents a complex
number in polar coordinates.

name: compareTo
desc: Compares this object to another object.

name: copyWith
desc:
Creates a deep copy of this object and replaces (if non-null) the
given values with the old ones.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: phiDegrees
desc: The 'phi' angle expressed in degrees.

name: phiRadians
desc: The 'phi' angle expressed in radians.

name: r
desc:
A wrapper class, returned by a Complex object, that represents a complex
number in polar coordinates.
The absolute value/modulus of the complex number.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: PolynomialInterpolation
desc:
Polynomial interpolation using Lagrange's interpolation formula to find
the unique polynomial of degree n-1 that passes through n given data
points.

name: PolynomialInterpolation.new
desc:
Polynomial interpolation using Lagrange's interpolation formula to find
the unique polynomial of degree n-1 that passes through n given data
points.

name: buildPolynomial
desc:
Computes the interpolation polynomial and returns it as an Algebraic
object.

name: compute
desc: Evaluates the Lagrange interpolation polynomial at the given point x.

name: PolynomialLongDivision
desc:
Implements the polynomial long division algorithm, which divides one
polynomial by another polynomial.

name: PolynomialLongDivision.new
desc:
Implements the polynomial long division algorithm, which divides one
polynomial by another polynomial.

name: divide
desc: Performs polynomial long division of polyNumerator by polyDenominator.

name: Quadratic

Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a second degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^2 + bx + c = 0.

desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a second degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^2 + bx + c = 0.

name: Quadratic.realEquation

Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a second degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^2 + bx + c = 0.

The first coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c = 0

name: b
desc:
The second coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c = 0

name: c
desc:
The third coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c = 0

name: Quartic
desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a fourth degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^4 + bx^3 + cx^2 + dx + e = 0.

desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a fourth degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^4 + bx^3 + cx^2 + dx + e = 0.

name: Quartic.realEquation
desc:
Concrete implementation of Algebraic that represents a fourth degree
polynomial equation in the form ax^4 + bx^3 + cx^2 + dx + e = 0.

name: a
desc:
The first coefficient of the equation in the form
f(x) = ax^4 + bx^3 + cx^2 + dx + e = 0

name: b
desc:
The second coefficient of the equation in the form

name: epsilon
desc:
The value used to check if a coefficient is very close to zero. In other
words, if |a| < epsilon, then a is considered to be zero.

name: maxCoefficient
desc:
The maximum value a coefficient can have. If a coefficient is greater
than this value, an exception will be thrown.

name: minCoefficient
desc:
The minimum value a coefficient can have. If a coefficient is less than
this value, an exception will be thrown.

name: solutions
desc: Finds the roots (the solutions) of the associated P(x) = 0 equation.

name: RealMatrix

matrix is filled with diagonalValue in the main diagonal and zeros
elsewhere.

Creates a new NxM matrix where rows is N and columns is M. The
matrix is filled with values from data.

matrix is filled with values from data.

name: RealMatrix.new

matrix is filled with zeros.

Performs spline interpolation given a set of control points. The algorithm
can compute a "monotone cubic spline" or a "linear spline" based on the
properties of the control points.

name: SystemSolver
